Title:
Diaporthe juglandicola sp. nov. (Diaporthales, Ascomycetes),
evidenced by morphological characters and phylogenetic analysis.
Abstract:
Diaporthe juglandicola sp. nov, collected from diseased
branches of Juglans mandshurica in Beijing, China, is described and
illustrated in this paper. This new species is introduced combined its
holomorphic morphology and phylogeny analysis. Morphologically, the
asexual morph produces hyaline, aseptate, ellipsoidal alpha conidia
(8.18.7 × 2.32.9 μm), while the sexual morph produces 8-spored,
unitunicate, clavate to cylindric asci and fusoid, 0-1-septate
ascospores. The phylogeny inferred from combined multi-locus sequences
(CAL, HIS, ITS, TEF1-α, TUB) also grouped isolates into a distinct
lineages.
